page.title: 20Agriculture in Laggan
page.content: There are 4 farms in the given area. All the farms have beef cattle and hill sheep. Farmers have been very successful in finding new methods of cultivating and harvesting crops. The Laggan Machinery group have helped in doing this. The spring and summer are the busiest seasons. In the spring the lambing takes a while. The sheep clipping and hay-making take up a lot of the time in the summer. An old tradition in Laggan is that everybody in the farm helps with the hay and potato picking. Sheep have to be thouroughly dipped early in the year. Crops grown are barly, grass, oil-seed rape and turnips either for silage or fodder. Our climate is very severe and the farmers fight a constant battle with the weather.
